accordion.accordion_title: What is Accutane and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Accutane is a medication used to treat severe acne. It is typically used as a last resort, as it can cause a variety of severe side effects. It is known as a retinoid, and works by reducing oil production in the skin and allowing your skin to renew at a quicker rate.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you need Accutane, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if it is right for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for Accutane?
accordion.accordion_intro: Accutane is used to treat severe acne, known a cystic or nodular acne.
accordion.accordion_content: You can find out if you have sever accutane symptoms by speaking to a doctor on Maple here.

accordion.accordion_intro: Accutane should be used as a doctor recommends. Dosages vary depending on the patient’s weight and scenario, however typically, it is taken for 15 – 20 weeks. Accutane is required to be taken with food, as it needs to be absorbed to be most effective.
accordion.accordion_content: It’s important to speak to your doctor to find out the right dosage and frequency of the medication for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Accutane?
accordion.accordion_intro: Accutane can cause your skin to become very dry, typically focused around the lips and mouth. Additionally, nosebleeds, upset stomach, extreme sun sensitivity, and hair thinning are all common side effects. Accutane in rare instances may cause pancreatitis, severe headaches, vision changes, or even chest pain.
accordion.accordion_content: If any of these side effects persist, it is important to stop taking Accutane and to consult with a doctor.

accordion.accordion_intro: Accutane can not be taken if you are pregnant, as it can cause serious birth-defects and potentially a miscarriage. Additionally, Accutane may contain active ingredients such as Vitamin A, which you may be allergic to.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
